subject: p14851532
History: Year old man with sepsis, COPD, and CHF, likely from cholangitis, now febrile, tachypnic, and tachycardic. STAT exam as patient has substantial clinical change and looks ill, worsening pulmonary edema new infiltrates acute intra pulm process worsening pulmonary edema new infiltrates acute intra pulm process.
Impression: Heart size is enlarged. Mediastinum is stable. Multifocal opacities are present, overall similar to previous study but potentially minimally improved. No appreciable pneumothorax. Old rib fractures, unchanged.
